intro: Ouratea wurdackiana, commonly known as the white starwood, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, clustered white flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural collections in warm climates.
